body.p: A Virginia-born, Kentucky attorney and politician. Educated at Hampden-Sidney Academy and graduated from the University of Virginia in 1834. Studied law and was admitted to the bar. Practiced law in Vicksburg, Mississippi and Covington, Kentucky. Married to Sibella Winston Stevenson. Father of Mary Winston Stevenson Colston, Sally Coles Stevenson Colston, Andrew Stevenson, Judith Stevenson, and John White Stevenson, Jr. Served as Kenton County attorney. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1845 to 1849. Served as a delegate to the 1849 Kentucky Constitutional Convention. Appointed as a commissioner to revise the Civil and Criminal Code of Kentucky in 1850-51. Served as a Democratic Party presidential elector in 1852 and 1856. Served the Tenth Congressional District of Kentucky as a Democratic member of the United States House of Representative from 1857 to 1861.
